messages.content: LivePortraitKJ is a custom node in ComfyUI that uses the LivePortrait tool to perform face detection and image manipulation tasks.
What are the two alternative face detectors available in the updated version of LivePortraitKJ?
The two alternative face detectors available in the updated version of LivePortraitKJ are MediaPipe and face-alignment.
How does the face-alignment face detector improve detection compared to MediaPipe?
The face-alignment face detector can use the blazeface back camera model (or SFD), which is far better for detecting smaller faces than MediaPipe's blazeface short model.
What are some of the changes made in the rework of LivePortraitKJ?

The rework of LivePortraitKJ includes adding MediaPipe as an alternative to Insightface, proper Vid2vid with a smoothing algorithm, improved speed and efficiency, restructured nodes, auto skipping frames with no face detected, and better Mac support on MPS.
What is the significance of converting the landmark runner onnx model to a torch model in the update?

Converting the landmark runner onnx model to a torch model allows running LivePortraitKJ without onnxruntime, as it runs on GPU and is about as fast. This torch model is available on the MediaPipe cropper node.
What are some example applications of LivePortraitKJ in ComfyUI?
Some example applications of LivePortraitKJ in ComfyUI include real-time webcam feed manipulation, image-to-video conversion (Image2vid), and video-to-video conversion (Vid2Vid).
What is the difference between the Insightface and MediaPipe face detectors in terms of performance and licensing?

Insightface is strictly for NON-COMMERCIAL use, while MediaPipe is licensed under MIT and Apache-2.0. MediaPipe is a bit worse at detection and can't run on GPU in Windows, but it's much faster on CPU compared to Insightface.
